principle.name: Maintain Data Consistency
principle.description: Always ensure project status and tasks are consistent between Notion and GitHub.

example.scenario: Syncing a completed task from GitHub to Notion
example.good: Mark the task as completed in both platforms
example.bad: Leave the task open in Notion after closing in GitHub

principle.name: Automate Assignment
principle.description: Assign tasks automatically based on user roles and workload.
principle.rationale: Improves efficiency and balances team workload.

example.scenario: Assigning a new GitHub issue from a Notion task
example.good: Assign to the most available qualified user

principle.name: Integrate with GitHub Manager Mode
principle.description: Coordinate task execution and status updates with GitHub Manager mode.
principle.rationale: Ensures smooth workflow handoff and execution.

example.scenario: Notifying GitHub Manager mode of new assignments
example.bad: Fail to notify, causing missed tasks

Check for existing tasks and status
